Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Portable, Low-Cost Coronary Anastomosis Simulator for Cardiothoracic Surgery Residents

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter, observational, analytical study included all junior and senior residents from nine national cardiothoracic surgery centers in 2022.

Participants.evidence: This multicenter, observational, analytical study included all junior and senior residents from nine national cardiothoracic surgery centers in 2022.

Intervention.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a portable, low-cost coronary anastomosis simulator in improving operative skills among cardiothoracic surgery residents.

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a portable, low-cost coronary anastomosis simulator in improving operative skills among cardiothoracic surgery residents.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the acquisition of operative skills and reduction in anastomosis time for side-to-side (S-T-S), end-to-side (E-T-S), and end-to-end (E-T-E) coronary anastomoses.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 140 residents were assessed in 270 sessions.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 140 residents were assessed in 270 sessions.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Senior residents also showed a significant reduction in anastomosis time compared to juniors in S-T-S (8.11 vs. 11.22 minutes), E-T-S (7.93 vs. 10.10 minutes), and E-T-E (6.56 vs. 9.68 minutes) (p = 0.039).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was not registered, and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: The study was not registered, and funding details were not provided.
